author: Collector_Nonas
title: Kai Bursts Through with a Good, New Spinner
review:
First Look: The Spinjitzu Burst spinners awed me at my first glance.  I knew I was going to pick one, but which one?  They all look amazing.  The minifigures are obviously the focus, but the spinners look nice too and the base is built up nicely.  The colors are great, but in my opinion, Kai's set has a bit too much red.  Other than this, the set looks great.

Build: The set's build was simple and only took me a few minutes.  The pieces are very nice and fairly rare.  It has a good collection of interesting pieces that can be put to good use in other situations.  I dislike the blue pin on the black disk you hit, but other than that (and a pink piece that just barely shows through) I'm not unhappy with the colors.  The spinner looks very nice and the pieces that fall away are good-looking.

Playability: The spinner works okay... the placement of the (ugly) blue rubber band prevents the spinner from “bursting” open the entire time.  It also requires quite the slam in order to “burst” open in the first place.  (Note: I watched several review videos on the bursts and none of them could get the spinners open; it's really not very hard).  The spinning works nicely and although it scrapes on the ground for a couple of seconds, it begins moving smoothly and the transition from open to closed as it slows down is very smooth and satisfying. 

Price: The price of the burst is pretty typical of Ninjago's smaller spinner-type sets.  The price-to-part ratio isn't great, but they are decently large.  The Kai minifigure is amazing, so $10 seems pretty nice.  For what I have... I would really like some sort of sale but less than $10 for a LEGO set is completely unrealistic.

Packaging: The box is amazing.  It was very cool-looking for a Ninjago set, and the way it folds up reminds me of a McDonald's Happy Meal.  It was a lot smaller than I thought, but the pictures (especially the Kai art) are also amazing.

Kai: Kai is one of the most amazing Ninjago exclusive minifigures I've ever seen.  His mask is similar and looks the similar past renditions.  His face looks amazing, and I have loved the way Kai's animation looks in even the new Ninjago show.  His eyes glow, the fire that streaks down his fierce face.  The fire all over him is nice and contrasts nicely with the red.  Kai's robes look almost sensei-like to me, which I enjoy.  The dragon on his back is absolutely stunning.  I'm in awe with this figure.

Recap: This spinner is similar, and the best parts of the set are the minifigure, box, and parts are the best parts of the set.  Overall, I'm happy with this.
